english: long (time); for a long time; long-standing; a long while

etymology.description: pictogram: arrow tip; used interchangeably with 氒 in oracle bone script.
etymology.interpretation: Early forms sketched a pointed arrowhead, emphasizing a sharp, elongated tip. That visual of extension likely motivated or was later borrowed to represent temporal length, yielding the sense of “for a long time.”

examples.chinese: 我等了很久(我等了很久)。
examples.english: I waited for a long time.

examples.chinese: 我们相识已久(我們相識已久)。
examples.english: We have known each other for a long time.

examples.chinese: 这家公司的历史悠久(這家公司的歷史悠久)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā gōngsī de lìshǐ yōujiǔ.
examples.english: This company has a long history.
